intro: Eriocaulon quinquangulare, commonly known as the five-angled flat sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually green or brown and lack showy petals, typical of many sedges. Eriocaulon quinquangulare plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
